newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: HYPERION SOFTWARE SEES BRISK ASIA GROWTH.
newsitem.headline: HYPERION SOFTWARE SEES BRISK ASIA GROWTH.

text.p: U.S.-based Hyperion Software said on Tuesday it saw revenues in Asia growing strongly in its current financial year ending June 30, 1998.
"Our revenue (in Asia) grew 75 percent in the past year. We're looking for another 75 percent growth this (fiscal) year," Richard Lisbin, Hyperion's Asia Pacific director of sales, told reporters.
Hyperion develops and markets planning and budgeting, accounting, multi-source consolidation, business reporting and analysis software.
Lisbin said the company did not report revenues for geographic regions but added that some 35 percent of revenue came from outside the United States.
For the year ended June 30, 1997, Hyperion recorded net profit of US$11.9 million on revenue of US$222.8 million.
Lisbin said the firm was aiming for another 30 new clients in Asia, excluding Japan, by the end of 1997.
It had signed up 24 first-time customers in the same region so far this year.
Including Japan, Hyperion now has 160 clients.
Its growth in the region would be through both new clients and developing more business within existing ones, Lisbin said.
Hyperion is looking to set up offices in Malaysia and Indonesia after opening offices in Singapore, Hong Kong and Japan.
It has a training centre in Singapore and Hong Kong and a hotline in Singapore that supports the region.
Hyperion was working on providing the ability to do transactions reporting within the Web, Lisbin said.
A year ago, the firm launched its Spiderman tool which allows a company to share sophisticated financial reports among its subsidaries through Web technologies.
